stories.text:
One thing the Internet has done beautifully is level the playing field with regard to information.

Today it's easier than ever before to do your own research and de-program yourself from the man-made shackles that are most organized religions. It's all a thinly veiled scheme to hijack human minds for the clergy's own power and agendas.

If you really want to love your fellow human beings, don't draw exclusive group boundaries and then focus primarily on helping only "the members". This tribalism mostly succeeds at generating us vs. them mentalities and attitudes. Is that really what a loving god would be about?

The Unitarian organization is okay (I have no affiliation, I've met a few over the years). The exception is because they leave most of the structure up to each individual to choose for themselves, and don't pressure others to conform. The result is a group of genuinely curious folks.

See also: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=31414788
